title: Environmental taxes and fees
maintainer_displayname: ZBO | Centraal Bureau voor de Statistiek
name: environmental-taxes-and-fees
notes:
This table presents an overview of the revenues of the environmental taxes and fees. The government charges several taxes and fees to support and finance environmental policy. 
The revenues of environmental taxes and fees can be attributed by taxpayer, distinguishing private households, industries and non-residents.
The above mentioned revenues of environmental taxes and fees are presented in the following variables:
-value in current prices, million euros.

Data available from: 2001

Status of the figures: 
The figures for the most recent reporting year 2013 are provisional. The figures for 2012 are revised provisional. The figures for 2011 are final.
All national accounts figures for 2001-2010 are provisional. This is because the revision of the national accounts has not been completed for the years before 2011. The revision, among other things, is needed to incorporate the European System of Accounts 2010. 

Changes as of September 29, 2014:
None, this is a new table.
In 2014, Statistics the Netherlands has conducted a major revision on their macro-economic data. The national accounts have been compiled in accordance with the guidelines and concepts of the new European System of Accounts 2010 (ESA 2010). In addition, new statistical sources and estimation methods have been used during the revision. Simultaneously, the figures of the environmental taxes and fees have been revised. This table shows the figures after revision.

When will new figures be published?
New figures are published annually in October, simultaneously with the publication of the environmental accounts. The first update will take place in October 2015.
